p: It can be seen, from the data presented in Table 1, that the cytotoxicities of the preparations in both cell cultures were generally similar. At the same time, three of the four studied compounds feature low toxicity in cell cultures (CC 50 in the range 492–998 µM), while the non-nucleoside compound cm1pUY11 ( III) showed significantly more pronounced cytotoxic properties; this is probably due to the presence of the pivaloyloxymethyl group, which may hydrolyze to free pivalate, thus inhibiting L-carnitine metabolism in cells [ 17].
